metadata.title: CVE-2019-18180 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper Check for filenames with overly long extensions in PostMaster(sending in email) or uploading files (e.g. attaching files to mails) of((OTRS)) Community Edition and OTRS allows an remote attacker to cause anendless loop. This issue affects: OTRS AG: ((OTRS)) Community Edition 5.0.xversion 5.0.38 and prior versions; 6.0.x version 6.0.23 and prior versions.OTRS AG: OTRS 7.0.x version 7.0.12 and prior versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

otrs - 6.0.24-1
otrs2 - 6.0.24-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: otrs2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.24-1').
